intro: Phagnalon ballii subsp. nitidum, commonly known as the smooth phagnalon, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, daisy-like yellow flowers. This subspecies is native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa, particularly in South Africa. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. The plant is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native environment.
